assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes FTPS in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
FTPS is a secure internet protocol for the exchange of data over an Internet network. It makes data accessible on the web which is the first level of maturity defined in the Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star for Open Data.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:   
https://5stardata.info/en/

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
IETF has a formal review and approval so that all the relevant stakeholders can formally appeal or raise objections to the development and approval of specifications.
Each distinct version of an Internet standards-related specification is published as part of the "Request for Comments" (RFC) document series. This archival series is the official publication channel for Internet standards documents and other publications.
During the development of a specification, draft versions of the document are made available for informal review and comment by placing them in the IETF's "Internet-Drafts" directory, which is replicated on a number of Internet hosts. This makes an evolving working document readily available to a wide audience, facilitating the process of review and revision.

Standard process IETF:
https://www.ietf.org/standards/process/ 

Internet Best Current Practices IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2026

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, FTPS is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. FTPS is therefore licensed on a royalty-free basis.
No IPR disclosures have been submitted directly on the FTPS specification (RFC 4217).

Intellectual Property Rights in IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
FTPS was first published as a draft RFC in 1996, but the RFC was not finished until 2005. Since then, many implementations using FTPS have been done to secure FTP, which it proves that it is mature enough for the development of products and services.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Although FTPS is an alternative of FTP for a secure communication internet protocol and it has been supported by some commercial file transfer tools, SFTP is easier to implement and it works better over NATs and firewalls without the issues that hamper FTPS implementations. So, it does not have a complete market acceptance.

FTPS - Obsolescent Secure FTP:
https://www.ssh.com/ssh/ftp/ftps

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the time of elaborating this assessment, FTPS does not foster the creation of innovative solutions. Since its publication in 2005 as an extension of FTP, it has been used to secure the ordinary protocol FTP. However, another FTP extension with the same purpose as this specification, is raising its usage and FTPS is getting obsolete.

FTPS - Obsolescent Secure FTP:
https://www.ssh.com/ssh/ftp/ftps

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
FTPS is maintained and developed by IETF which is an international community developing open standards. 

Developer community IETF: 
https://www.ietf.org/about/

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
FTPS as an extension of FTP, is used for file exchange by some public organisations. By allowing public administration to share information with others, it fosters the visibility of data (e.g. administrative rules, processes etc.) and facilitates public administrations the decision-making. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
FTPS allows public administration to share and exchange information with others, so it helps with the visibility of data. However, FTPS is a protocol only intended to exchange the data, it doesn't help to comprehend it.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
FTPS is a protocol for data exchange, it allows the communication between multiple endpoints and it makes available interfaces for public administrations systems.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

statement:
FTPS is a business domain agnostic specification that can be reused in a cross-domain way.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

statement: There is no national or European platform with the specification FTPS available for free.

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
FTPS is an extension of the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) that adds support for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) to secure the data exchange. So it is dependant of FTP and TLS versions.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
FTPS is an extension of FTP that can be easily scaled if 4 principles are taken into account. These principles are explained in the following article.

Highly Scalable FTP Site:
https://www.ftptoday.com/blog/4-critical-features-of-a-highly-scalable-ftp-site

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)

P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The main purpose of FTPS as an extension of FTP is to allow the exchange of documents on the internet. So it clearly fosters data portability between systems and applications.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
FTPS is an extension of FTP which allows public administration to exchange information securely, so it avoids multiple requests of standard information to citizens or businesses. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of FTPS is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
FTPS is a network protocol for transferring files over the Internet. It has the same specifications as FTP but it uses the Transport Layer Security (TLS) to secure the communications.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The purpose of FTPS is not related to the delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
As an internet protocol for data exchange, FTPS can be used for secure exchange of documents over the Internet, which can reduce administrative burden. Moreover, FTPS can avoid the exchange of non-digital documents that are generally source of administrative burden.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of FTPS is not related to long term preservation of electronic records. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are documents that compare different secured versions of FTP (FTPS and SFTP), and the main differences between them. From there, it can be assessed the efficiency and effectiveness of the usage of FTPS in comparison with other type of FTP.

FTPS vs SFTP:
https://www.goanywhere.com/blog/2016/11/23/sftp-vs-ftps-the-key-differences

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
FTPS is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, FTPS can define the interoperability aspects of the "Network", "Networking Service", "Public Network" and "Private Network" ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are no tools that assess the conformity of FTPS implementations. However, there are online tools developed by the FTP community, which assess FTP and FTPS servers performance. 

FileZilla tests FTPS implementation:
https://filezilla-project.org/

criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
Germany is recommending FTPS in their ICT National Catalogues.

National catalogue Germany: 
http://www.cio.bund.de/SharedDocs/Publikationen/DE/Architekturen-und-Standards/SAGA/saga_modul_tech_spez_de_bund_5_0_download.pdf?__blob=publicationFile

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
Although FTPS is not the main specification used for FTP secured transfers, it has been selected for its use in the initiative "The Big Data Platform Initiative of the EC Joint Research Centre", it takes care of ensuring data transfer to EOS.

JRC Big Data Platform (JEODPP):
https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/cros/system/files/dawos18_lecture.soille.jeodpp.pdf

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 1 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. This Member States is Germany.

National catalogue Germany: 
http://www.cio.bund.de/SharedDocs/Publikationen/DE/Architekturen-und-Standards/SAGA/saga_modul_tech_spez_de_bund_5_0_download.pdf?__blob=publicationFile

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of FTPS within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

CENELEC search tool catalogue:
https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of FTPS is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of FTPS is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
FTPS does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but defines a network protocol for exchange data.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

assessment_title: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: File Transfer Protocol over Transport Layer Security (FTPS or FTP over TLS)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
According to the 5-star Open Data model suggested by Tim Berners-Lee about how to publish linked data, FTPS as an internet protocol for the exchange of data, supports the first level of maturity which corresponds to make data available as structured data.

FTPS IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4217

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
